newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia in 97 oil for sugar barter deal with Cuba.
newsitem.headline: Russia in 97 oil for sugar barter deal with Cuba.

text.p: Russia will buy 3.25 million tonnes of Cuban raw sugar in 1997 in exchange for sending Havana 9.75 million tonnes of Russian crude oil, according to a government decree reported on Friday.
Under the intergovernmental agreement, reported by the official Itar-Tass news agency, suppliers of goods under the barter deal will be selected through a tender.
It was not immediately clear whether the deal for 1997 was for portions of supplies due to have been delivered in previous years but held up over squabbles over pricing.
According to Tass, under an intergovernmental protocol covering 1996-1998, Russia supplied 1.8 million tonnes of crude oil to Cuba last year in exchange for over 850,000 tonnes of Cuban raws.
Tass also said earlier this week that total Russian imports of Cuban raws last year were 1.8 million tonnes, including 0.9 million tonnes supplied by outside traders.
About 85 percent of the $1.1 billion trade between the two countries last year was through oil-for-sugar barter deals. Some of the trade has shifted out of the government and into the private sector.
